getTimestamp().Description: Returns the date and time when the timestamp was generated.

Returns: A string comprising the date and time of the timestamp and its signer's certificate.
toString().Description: Returns a string describing this timestamp.

Parameters: Date: is the timestamp's date and time. It must not be null.
CertPath: is the TSA's certificate path. It must not be null.
Throws: if timestamp or signerCertPath is null.

Returns: true if the timestamp are considered equal, false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the object to test for equality with this timestamp.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Tests for equality between the specified object and this timestamp. Two timestamps are considered equal if the date and time of their timestamp's and their signer's certificate paths are equal.

getSignerCertPath().Description: Returns the certificate path for the Timestamping Authority.

Returns: a hash code value for this timestamp.
hashCode().Description: Returns the hash code value for this timestamp. The hash code is generated using the date and time of the timestamp and the TSA's certificate path.

ClassDesc: This class encapsulates information about a signed timestamp. It is immutable. It includes the timestamp's date and time as well as information about the Timestamping Authority (TSA) which generated and signed the timestamp.
